blog.title: Blog
blog.description: Here you will find the collection of knowledge that has been grabbed by me for the entire my career. Theory and practice. The best way to learn something is to start teach others, right? Well then, here you are!

projects.title: Projects
projects.description2: Here is the list of projects that have been created by me. There, you will find documentation, source code, general idea and/or my inspiration and implementation.

about.title: About
about.appreciating: I really appreciate you are interested in what I am doing.
about.reasonForReading: The blog you are reading at the moment was created to share the knowledge that I have acquired during my entire professional career. This simple static blog is my knowledge diary. Here I write down everything that I managed to learn and try to explain here to the misguided people in the simplest possible way. I sincerely believe that the best way to learn anything is to start teaching other people, sharing your knowledge with them. And I have several reasons for this:

sharingKnowledge.personalGrowth: Personal Growth - sharing your knowledge with others helps you to better understand and articulate your own thoughts and ideas, which can lead to personal growth and development.
sharingKnowledge.relationships: Building Relationships - sharing knowledge with others can foster strong relationships, as it shows that you value their opinions and are willing to help them grow and learn.
sharingKnowledge.influence: Increased Influence - by sharing your knowledge and expertise with others, you can establish yourself as a thought leader in your field and increase your influence and credibility.
sharingKnowledge.problems: Improved Problem-Solving - when you share knowledge with others, you can receive new perspectives and ideas that can help you tackle challenges and find solutions to problems more effectively.
sharingKnowledge.career: Career Advancement - sharing your knowledge can lead to new opportunities and recognition, which can help you advance in your career.
sharingKnowledge.givingBack: Giving Back - sharing your knowledge can be a way of giving back to others and making a positive impact on their lives.

whatIKnow.p0: As befits a real cybersecurity engineer, I need to mention all the programming languages and frameworks that I have ever worked with. Even though I'm no longer a professional programmer, and I don't think I'll ever return to this path, it brings me a lot of pleasure. I will even say more, I really started to enjoy it when I stopped doing it for money.
whatIKnow.p1: Due to the fact that my professional career started as a full stack web developer, I started and stopped in programming languages that are closely related to this. To be honest, I have never been attracted to low-level programming languages, but how the Internet works has always been interesting to me. Therefore, here are the main ones:
whatIKnow.p2: Naturally, being a web developer, it does not make sense to list programming languages, since all modern web applications are written using frameworks. I have tried different frameworks for both frontend and backend and here are the most important ones:
whatIKnow.p3: The more I wanted to become a cybersecurity engineer, the further I had to move away from everything that, even if partially, was related to programming. But I didn't mind, I always liked to learn something new, so I started to study more deeply how operating systems work. And of course, I started to build my own various servers, such as web servers, DNS servers, NTP servers and so on, and play with them:
whatIKnow.p4: The more I wanted to become a cybersecurity engineer, the further I had to move away from everything that, even if partially, was related to programming. But I didn't mind, I always liked to learn something new, so I started to study more deeply how operating systems work:
whatIKnow.p5: Well, this is where I am and what I know. I sincerely believe that this pursuit of knowledge will last all my life, but I will be lying if I say that this alignment of things does not suit me, there will always be something that I have to learn, and as Socrates said: "I know that I do not know anything". So, keep chasing!

about.overall: Overall, sharing knowledge with others can have a number of personal, professional, and societal benefits, making it a valuable and rewarding experience. By the way, if you are interested in more technical part of this blog, about its implementation, you won't find it here, just read README file on repository page.
about.contactInfo: In case if you have any issues/propositions or whatever reason you have to contact me you can do that using next channels, do not hesitate to do that. I'd love to hear your thoughts and ideas, so feel free to reach out and I will always be glad to have a small talk, so, here you go:
